alert.note: Alert for Eastern Kent; Newport; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Washington; Western Kent (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Windham, northeastern Washington, northwestern Newport, Kent and southern Providence Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sprague, or near Jewett City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Coventry, West Warwick, North Kingstown, Windham, Plainfield, East Greenwich, Scituate, Brooklyn, Hopkinton, Richmond, Exeter, West Greenwich, Jamestown, Canterbury, Foster, Sterling and Hampton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Connecticut...and Rhode Island.
